questions.question: CPU scheduling is the core of multiprogrammed operating systems.
By switching CPU cores among various processes, the operating system can make computers more efficient and productive.
In a single CPU core system, multiple processes can run simultaneously.
What is the core objective of a multiprogramming system?
choices: To minimize memory usage
To keep the CPU idle
To have some processes running at all times to maximize CPU utilization
To decrease process waiting time

questions.question: The idle time in a single CPU core system is wasted.
In a multiprogramming system, the CPU assigns the core to another process during idle CPU time.
What is the main function of the CPU scheduler?
choices: To execute processes in the order they arrive
To switch the CPU core between processes
To allocate memory to processes
To manage I/O devices

questions.question: The ready queue is necessarily a first-in, first-out (FIFO) queue.
Which of the following is NOT a CPU scheduling decision point?
choices: Switching from running to waiting state
Switching from waiting to ready state
Switching from running to terminated state
Switching from waiting to terminated state

questions.question: CPU utilization aims to keep the CPU as busy as possible.
What does the turnaround time measure?
choices: The amount of time a process has been waiting in the ready queue
The amount of time to execute a particular process
The number of processes that complete their execution per time unit
The amount of time it takes from when a request was submitted until the first response is produced

questions.question: First Come First Served (FCFS) scheduling algorithm uses a non-preemptive approach.
In FCFS scheduling, processes run until they are finished.
What is the main disadvantage of the First Come First Served scheduling algorithm?
choices: It is too complex.
It takes a lot of time to run.
It requires too much memory.
It is difficult to implement.

questions.question: Shortest Job First (SJF) scheduling algorithm serves the process with the shortest job first.
In Priority Scheduling, the CPU is allocated to the process with the highest priority (smallest integer means highest priority).
What problem does Priority Scheduling face?
choices: Starvation
Aging
Deadlock
Context switching

questions.question: In Priority Scheduling, aging is a solution to the problem of starvation.
